results.title: Australian diary. No. 003 (A)
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at a Brisbane creche; Spanish monks and nuns teach Aboriginal children at New Norcia, a mission in Western Australia; families shown mining mica at Harts Range in the Northern terrotory and a Victorian fashion parade as models exhibit the latest styles in woollen clothing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 002
results.brief_description: This diary features Kauri timber in Western Australia, Sydney from the air - how it looks from four miles up, a motor yacht regatta, Kingaroy’s peanut industry, ‘Bernborough’ winning the Doomben race, and spring at Mt. Kosciusko. No credits available.
results.description: This diary features Kauri timber in Western Australia, Sydney from the air - how it looks from four miles up, a motor yacht regatta, Kingaroy’s peanut industry, ‘Bernborough’ winning the Doomben race, and spring at Mt. Kosciusko. No credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 001
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following itms are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: seventy 16 footer class yachts race on Sydney Harbour; cattle being sold at Wodonga after travelling on the hoof; pineapple harvesting in Queensland; an expert and his children demonstrate boomerang throwing; the University of Western Australia and St. George’s College are shown; surfriding on huge seas at Manly is shown.

results.title: The Minemaker
results.creator_credit: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scientific observations of the Heron Island research staion on the Great Barrier Reef. Illustrates in detail the birds, fish and mammals of the area.

results.title: Road observation
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “How to Drive”.
Shows what to look for in driving, the effect of speed on vision and typical signs and hazards.

results.title: Railways at work
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Transport in Australia”.
Shows the vital role of railways in Australia’s economy. Includes scenes from each state to illustrate rolling stock, services and people who depend on railways, directly or indirectly.

results.title: The City of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Roger Climpson narrates this concise and interesting film on Melbourne. A brief history is outlined at the beginning noting some of the key figures who moved Melbourne from a settlement to a city, including John Batman and John Fawker. An incredible amount of material is fitted into the film’s short duration, including the outer central business locations like Albert Park, Flemington, St Kilda and Northland Shopping Centre, Preston. The newer multi-story buildings in the city are attractively shot. Opening shot of the infamous (now demolished) Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria building in its early stages of construction. Also includes footage of the Robin Boyd Southgate fountain sculpture in Snowden Gardens.

results.title: Fit For the Future
results.creator_credit: Physical Education Branch, Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Shows the range of physical education activities provided in Victorian primary schools. Running, jumping, folk dancing, tumbling, team games and swimming are all encouraged so as to develop physical potential.

results.title: Australia calling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Australia, moving from Western Australia through South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, the A.C.T., N.S.W. and Queensland. Scenes include timber getting, gold mining, grape and apple harvests, dairying, skiing, Federal Parliament, Sydney attractions, Blue Mountains, caves and beaches, cane cutting and the Great Barrier Reef.
